12.content:
"What if we went to Disney this summer?" Kate asked her kids, Laura and Rob, who were both furiously texting. "Mom, Disney is for little kids. We wouldn't have any fun now." Sighing, Kate shared that she had always wanted to take the kids to Disney, but had never had the money too. Now, she added, brightening up, she had just gotten a raise at work. Also, while the office was moving, she had three weeks off to go wherever she wanted for vacation that summer.

"I already bought the tickets, so we're going. I'm sure you'll have fun on the roller coasters, and I won't make you go on the Dumbo ride," Mom promised. As she finished, the doorbell to the house rang. At the door was a delivery man, who simply handed her a package, adding a warning of "Have fun" as he hopped back into his truck. Kate opened the package, lifting out an intricately carved silver charm hanging off a necklace. Puzzled, she turned the box over to see if there was a note. While there wasn't a note, there was a small card, printed with instructions for the necklace.

"Your life is changing. Inside this package is a silver charm. This charm has magical properties that allow people to transform their bodies by touching pieces of clothing to their bodies. Simply wearing the amulet and holding a piece of clothing will change the person's entire body into whoever wore the clothing last. Touching the charm and a piece of clothing to a corresponding body part will transform only that matching body part that the clothing goes with. Each user gets one use every 24 hours. Use it well."

Kate walked back into the kitchen.

info.brief_description: A person finds a magical necklace....what will they do with it?
info.description:
Please use proper grammar, spelling, etc. I will make edits, but mostly just grammatical corrections or fixing inconsistent stories or facts.

You are a person that finds a necklace that had magical properties. Are you:
1) A newly married couple
2) A single mom with teen kids
3) Single woman
4) Single male
5) College kid

Rules of the charm:
Once the charm had been used, the changes are permanent for a whole day, or 24 hours. The way the charm works is that when you touch a piece of clothing while wearing the charm, you become the last wearer of the clothes (those who wore the clothes to swap do not count, since they immediately became the last wearer as well). If you touch the charm and the piece of clothing to a certain body part, only that part transforms.

What the character doesn't know, but the writer does: If a character remains in a body for over a week, they start to adapt to that body. Say a thirty year old man becomes a 14 year old girl. After a period of over seven days, he would start to think more like a 14 year old girl than a thirty year old man. You keep your memories, but you have emotions and feelings, as well as desires and needs, that the body you are in would naturally have. However, if you change back, you will regain everything in the same amount of time you were in the other body.

If someone becomes pregnant while in a body, that body must be continually occupied to carry the baby to term.

While you are in the body, the body ages as normal. If you stayed in a 20 year old body for a year, then at the end of the year, you would be 21.
